role: Headquarters Air Force (HAF) & US Space Force (USSF) Policy

description: Appointed leaders who ensure their assigned specialties are trained and utilized to support the mission. They approve waivers, develop the Career Field Education and Training Plan (CFETP), and chair training requirement meetings.

role: Air Force Personnel Center, Work Force Development
description: Develops guidance to implement training policy, manages training program operations, and coordinates on CFETPs.
Directs and manages formal training schools, serves as the Force Development Registrar, develops Career Development Courses (CDCs), and leads advanced distributed learning.
Advise CFMs on training pipelines, coordinate course revisions, and manage resources to ensure effective execution of training.

role: MAJCOM Functional Managers / Advisors & NGB CFMs
description: Manage training programs for their respective specialties at the Major Command or National Guard Bureau level, providing guidance to subordinate units and representing the command at training workshops.
Serve as the command's focal point for skills development, managing and assessing the effectiveness of the command's overall training program.
Has authority and responsibility to develop, deliver, and manage all Total Force CDCs and specialized courses for upgrade training.
The base-level OPR for managing all training programs, including upgrade, qualification, and ancillary training for units they service.
The senior ranking Education and Training (3F2X1) member on an installation, responsible for ensuring Unit Training Managers are trained and managing 3F2X1 assignments.
Ultimately responsible for their unit's training programs, ensuring members attend training, and taking action on training-related issues like withdrawals or failures to progress.

role: Unit Training Managers / Additional Duty UTMs
description: The commander's key staff member for managing the unit's training program, advising personnel, tracking progress, and managing training records.
Directly responsible for the trainee's development. They plan, conduct, evaluate, and document training, develop task lists, and administer the CDC program for their Airmen.
A subject-matter expert selected to provide hands-on, 'over-the-shoulder' training to a trainee and document their task qualifications.
Provides third-party certification and evaluation on specific tasks identified by the CFM to ensure a trainee is fully qualified.
The individual undergoing training, responsible for actively participating, completing requirements, and obtaining qualifications.
The office or individual responsible for developing, managing, and updating a specific Total Force Awareness Training (TFAT) course.
The senior leader 'gatekeeper' body that vets new TFAT requirements, establishes priorities, and determines efficient delivery options for the Total Force.
